title: Medieval Dungeon Adventure #35
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Dark Dungeon Cell
rooms.description: A damp stone cell lit by a single flickering torch. The walls are covered in moss and ancient scratches. Iron chains hang from the ceiling, and the air smells of mildew and despair. A heavy wooden door with iron bands blocks the only exit.

items.name: stone sleeping platform
items.description: A crude bed carved from stone, covered with moldy straw

items.name: long rusty nail
items.description: A bent iron nail, possibly useful for picking locks

items.name: scratches on wall
items.description: Deep scratches carved into the stone wall by previous prisoners
items.text: The scratches form words: 'The guard's birth year was 1453. His keys are in the middle drawer. The captain's name is Sir Aldric. The treasure lies in the vault beneath the castle.'

items.name: old wooden bucket
items.description: A rotting bucket in the corner of the cell

items.name: torn parchment
items.description: A note hidden by a previous prisoner
items.text: To whoever finds this: I am Sir Edmund, wrongly imprisoned by the tyrant lord. The guard keeps his keys locked away. Remember the year of the great siege - 1453. May you find freedom where I could not.

items.name: iron_banded cell door
items.description: A heavy oak door reinforced with iron bands. The lock looks old but sturdy.

rooms.name: Guard's Chamber
rooms.description: A circular room with weapon racks on the walls displaying swords, spears, and shields. A wooden table holds the remains of a meal and a half-empty flagon of ale. Torches burn in wall sconces, casting dancing shadows. Tapestries depicting battle scenes hang between the weapon displays.

items.name: wooden weapon rack
items.description: A rack holding various medieval weapons

items.name: guard's iron sword
items.description: A well-maintained sword with the castle crest on the pommel

items.name: guard's table
items.description: A sturdy oak table covered with food scraps and documents

items.name: guard duty roster
items.description: A parchment listing guard assignments and schedules
items.text: Guard Roster: Captain Sir Aldric commands the dungeon watch. All guards report to him. The vault treasure is kept secure in the chamber beyond. Only those who know the captain's name, the treasure's location, and the dungeon's purpose may pass.

items.name: guard's storage chest
items.description: A large wooden chest with three compartments, bound with iron straps

items.name: guard's personal journal
items.description: A leather-bound journal with daily entries
items.text: Journal Entry: Another day guarding these wretched prisoners. Captain Sir Aldric inspected the dungeon today. He reminded us that this place exists to hold enemies of the realm. The vault beyond contains the lord's treasure, secured by three questions only the worthy can answer.

items.name: ornate brass key
items.description: A decorative brass key with intricate engravings

items.name: battle tapestry
items.description: A large tapestry showing a medieval battle scene
items.text: The tapestry depicts the Siege of 1453, where the castle successfully defended against invaders. Below the image, text reads: 'This dungeon was built to hold the enemies captured in that glorious battle.'

items.name: locked wall cabinet
items.description: A small cabinet mounted on the wall with a brass lock

items.name: vault access scroll
items.description: Official instructions for accessing the treasure vault
items.text: VAULT ACCESS PROTOCOL: To enter the treasure chamber, answer these questions correctly: Who commands this dungeon? Where is the treasure kept? Why does this dungeon exist?

items.name: reinforced vault door
items.description: A massive iron door with elaborate locks and a stone panel bearing three inscribed questions

password_questions.question: Who commands this dungeon?
password_questions.hint: Check the duty roster and guard's journal for the captain's name

password_questions.question: Where is the treasure kept?
password_questions.hint: The wall scratches in your cell mentioned this

password_questions.question: Why does this dungeon exist?
password_questions.hint: The guard's journal and tapestry explain the dungeon's purpose

rooms.name: Royal Treasure Vault
rooms.description: You have reached the legendary treasure vault! The chamber glows with golden light reflecting off piles of coins, jeweled crowns, and ornate artifacts. Chests overflow with precious gems and ancient relics. A secret passage in the far wall leads to freedom outside the castle walls.

items.name: mountain of gold coins
items.description: An enormous pile of gold and silver coins from across the realm

items.name: royal crown
items.description: A magnificent crown encrusted with rubies, emeralds, and sapphires

items.name: ornate treasure chest
items.description: A chest filled with precious artifacts and ancient treasures

items.name: hidden escape passage
items.description: A concealed passage leading out of the castle to freedom
items.text: This secret tunnel was built as an escape route for the royal family. It leads beyond the castle walls to safety.

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You have escaped the dungeon and discovered the royal treasure vault! With your newfound wealth and freedom, you slip through the secret passage and emerge outside the castle walls. The tyrant lord's reign over you has ended. You are free, and you are rich! You win!
